raw.title: [BIP-423] Enable new wstETH gauges [Gnosis Chain]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/499

## [BIP-418] Enable new wstETH gauges [Gnosis Chain]

With the goals of maximising capital efficiency in Gnosis Chain, we have been doing some analysis into what’s the optimal liquidity structure. Therefore, we propose to enable some gauges.

### Gauges to enable:

`50wstETH-50staBAL3`

`50wstETH-25AURA-25BAL`

`50wstETH-50COW`

`50wstETH-50GNO`

### Implementation:

|Pool|Pool address|Gnosis Chain gauge|Mainnet gauge|
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
|wstETH/staBAL3|[0xeb30c85cc528537f5350cf5684ce6a4538e13394](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xeb30c85cc528537f5350cf5684ce6a4538e13394)|[0xef23c2ec60a1ea3ed6a44681fb72356cb411177e](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xef23c2ec60a1ea3ed6a44681fb72356cb411177e)|[0xf0d3268d36Adf812Fa69756500D72A899D4c2420](https://etherscan.io/address/0xf0d3268d36Adf812Fa69756500D72A899D4c2420)|
|wstETH/GNO|[0x4683e340a8049261057D5aB1b29C8d840E75695e](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x4683e340a8049261057D5aB1b29C8d840E75695e)|[0xb812249d60b80c7cbc9398e382ed6dfdf82e23d2](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xb812249d60b80c7cbc9398e382ed6dfdf82e23d2)|[0xb1af0D75AEEa1c13c450ffc7e12083072DAf41eb](https://etherscan.io/address/0xb1af0D75AEEa1c13c450ffc7e12083072DAf41eb)|
|wstETH/COW|[0x4cdABE9E07ca393943AcFB9286bBbd0D0a310Ff6](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x4cdABE9E07ca393943AcFB9286bBbd0D0a310Ff6)|[0xce18a3d0d928ab8883f355b5009d2de07d5c1d83](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0xce18a3d0d928ab8883f355b5009d2de07d5c1d83)|[0x93AE6971F03CE890FA4e9274Ab441477b84DAE5f](https://etherscan.io/address/0x93AE6971F03CE890FA4e9274Ab441477b84DAE5f)|
|wstETH/AURA/BAL|[0x00dF7f58e1Cf932eBe5f54De5970Fb2Bdf0ef06D](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x00dF7f58e1Cf932eBe5f54De5970Fb2Bdf0ef06D)|[0x64cee2356f959e78db36a4c23a28f0454447c3df](https://gnosisscan.io/address/0x64cee2356f959e78db36a4c23a28f0454447c3df)|[0x64fCeD4684f4B065E6b900c4E99a0CBaCC5E5fe1](https://etherscan.io/address/0x64fCeD4684f4B065E6b900c4E99a0CBaCC5E5fe1)| 

### Specification:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd`and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0xf0d3268d36Adf812Fa69756500D72A899D4c2420`

gauge(address):`0xb1af0D75AEEa1c13c450ffc7e12083072DAf41eb`

raw.title: [BIP-462] Enable axlETH/WETH Gauge [Base]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/583

**Summary:**
> This proposal is meant to activate an uncapped gauge for a stable axlETH/WETH pool on Base network. axlETH is from axelar and essentially acts as a fast bridging option between many of the networks the Balancer supports. The assets they support related to us are axlBAL, axlUSDC, and axlETH all of which now have deployments for Balancer on Base. The goal for Balancer in the short term is to activate these gauges and propose the Axelar supports the liquidity hosted on Balancer via their [community pools initiatives.](https://docs.axelar.dev/resources/governance/community-pool-proposals) 

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
    • [Website](https://satellite.money/?source=ethereum&destination=osmosis&asset_denom=uusdc)
    • [Documentation](https://docs.axelar.dev/)
    • [Github Page](https://github.com/axelarnetwork)    
    • [Communities](https://twitter.com/axelarcore)


**Protocol Description:**

> Axelar delivers secure cross-chain communication for Web3, enabling you to build Interchain dApps that grow beyond a single chain. *Secure* means Axelar is built on proof-of-stake, the battle-tested approach used by Ethereum, Polygon, Cosmos, and more. *Cross-chain communication* means you can build a complete experience for your users that lets them interact with any asset, any application, on any chain with one click.

**Motivation:**

> Primarily expansion of the partnership with axelar by supporting one another's initiatives on Base to start. This in turn expands the market and TVL for Balancer on Base. 

**Specifications:**
 
1. **Governance:** Governance for axelar can best be described on their forum [here](https://community.axelar.network/t/about-the-governance-and-grants-category/2269). 

2. **Oracles:** N/A

3. **Audits:** Audit reports can be seen [here](https://github.com/axelarnetwork/audits). 

4. **Centralization vectors:** The axelar network is governed by the AXL token and it's holders. How to participate is described on their [forum](https://community.axelar.network/t/governance-faqs/2284). 

5. **Market History:** ETH is generally well known in the market and axlETH is a wrapping mechanism which is fully redeemable for ETH. 
 
6. **Value:** This pool will serve as an easy to use hub for users bridging ETH from network to network and wanting to get in and out of the Base network in a timely manor. With Balancer as the hub for this asset TVL and volume will increase as well as overall visibility on the network. 

Pool address: [0x30722f57D56037CAA2C38ABD1F5E2955814875e9](https://app.balancer.fi/#/base/pool/0x30722f57d56037caa2c38abd1f5e2955814875e9000000000000000000000087)
Root gauge address: [0xb145b0eF7Dfd7E02b181f4c9a880e8aeCED9bCf3](https://etherscan.io/address/0xb145b0eF7Dfd7E02b181f4c9a880e8aeCED9bCf3#code)

Specification: 

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0xb145b0eF7Dfd7E02b181f4c9a880e8aeCED9bCf3`
gaugeType(string): `Base`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-459] Enable TetuBAL/20WETH-80BAL Gauge [Polygon]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/579

**Summary:**
The purpose of this proposal is to enable gauge for the newly [created](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0x7af62c1ebf97034b7542ccec13a2e79bbcf34380000000000000000000000c13) tetuBal/20WETH-80BAL with updated AMP (**20** instead of **500**) to align with the recommendations from the balancer core team and community. All the other parameters are the same as in the existing [pool](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0xb797adfb7b268faeaa90cadbfed464c76ee599cd0002000000000000000005ba).

Previous gauge [proposal](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-8-enable-tetubal-20weth-80bal-gauge/3335)

**References/Useful links:**

> Link to:
*    Previous gauge [proposal](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-8-enable-tetubal-20weth-80bal-gauge/3335)
* Website -[ https://tetu.io/ 2 ](https://tetu.io/)
* Documentation -[ Introduction - Tetu ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/)
* Github Page -[ Tetu · GitHub ](https://github.com/tetu-io)
* Communities -[ Tetu ]()

**Protocol Description:**

Tetu is an asset management protocol that implements automated yield farming strategy for users.

**Motivation:**
To maintain tetuBal peg and attract more liquidity to the pool. It will be beneficial for both Balancer and Tetu protocols.

 
**Specifications:**

1. Governance:[ Multi Sig - Tetu ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/security/multi-sig)
2. Oracles: No
3. Audits:[ docs.tetu.io ](https://docs.tetu.io/tetu-io/security/audits)
4. Centralization vectors: n/a
5. Market History: Tetu token can be volatile in the certain market conditions.


Composable Stable Pool: [0x7aF62C1ebf97034B7542CcEC13a2e79BbcF34380](https://polygonscan.com/address/0x7aF62C1ebf97034B7542CcEC13a2e79BbcF34380)

Gauge: [0xF6A814eD60653Cb0e36DA247B01E6309318328d4](https://etherscan.io/address/0xF6A814eD60653Cb0e36DA247B01E6309318328d4)

### Technical Specification
The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:`0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address):`0xF6A814eD60653Cb0e36DA247B01E6309318328d4`
gaugeType(string): `Polygon`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-434] Enable wstETH/4Pool Gauge [Arbitrum]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/517

Summary:

This is a proposal to enable the gauge on Arbitrum for the wstETH / 4 weighted pool. As Balancer doubles down on the Arbitrum ecosystem with the updated airdrop incentives program, it makes sense for Balancer to have a liquidity route between stable coins and wstETH. This will facilitate a path for trades to be routed through and as the pool TVL grows, more swaps will be sent to Balancer through aggregators.

Protocol Description:

wstETH, is Lido’s wrapped staked Ethereum. USDC is the dollar backed stablecoin issued by Circle (USDC.e being the bridged version and USDC native version on optimism). DAI is the decentralized overcollateralized stablecoin by MakerDAO. USDT is the dollar backed stablecoin issued by Tether.

Motivation:

This proposal aims to add an uncapped veBAL gauge for the wstETH/4Pool (USDC-USDT-DAI-USDC.e) on Arbitrum, and request “core” pool status.

Specifications:

1. Governance: Not applicable.
2. Oracles: No.
3. Audits: Not applicable.
4. Centralization vectors: There are centralization risks with USDC, DAI, and USDT, though the market has clearly accepted those as minor for now.
5. Market History: Bespoke stable tokens have well-known market history.
6. Value: We will earn the protocol fee on trading. BIP-19 will incentivize TVL to continue to grow.

Pool: [0xA1a8bf131571A2139FEB79401aA4A2E9482Df627](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xa1a8bf131571a2139feb79401aa4a2e9482df627#code)

Gauge: [0xa8Bb331a84032b156E5c670152A5Bd48f5DeC784](https://etherscan.io/address/0xa8Bb331a84032b156E5c670152A5Bd48f5DeC784#code)

Specification:

The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the addGauge function with the following arguments:
gauge(address): `0xa8Bb331a84032b156E5c670152A5Bd48f5DeC784`
gaugeType(string): `Arbitrum`

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-772] Enable Boosted GHO/PYUSD on Balancer v3
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1715

>## Summary
>
>This publication proposes creating a new gauge for the Boosted GHO/PYUSD Pool on Ethereum.
>
>This pool is to be considered “core pool”, meaning the protocol fees earned by these pool would be used to bribe for votes on it.

>## Motivation
>
>With both Buffer Pools adequately funded, this publication proposes enabling the gauge. 
>
>Balancer v3 - Boosted GHO / PYUSD
>
>Each asset is deployed into Aave v3 to earn yield.
>
>* GHO into Aave Prime
>* PYUSD into Aave Core
>
>The PYUSD deposits into the Core instance of Aave v3 will benefit from the ongoing liquidity mining program with [4.00% yield](https://governance.aave.com/t/arfc-pyusd-reserve-configuration-update-incentive-campaign/19573) being provided until a target of 75M in deposits is achieved. 
>
>Details relating to GHO and PYUSD specifically are well documented in [previous gauge submissions](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-736-enable-gho-pyusd-e-clp-gauge-ethereum/6202). 

>## Specification
>
>Enable Gauge
>
>The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` and call the `addGauge` function with the following arguments based on the table above:
>
>Pool address: `0x64B84023CfE8397dF83C67eACCC2C03ecDA4aeE5`
>Gauge(address): `0x6C0a4550C575C917435F228D36939125A437a98b`
>Rate Providers: `0x851b73c4BFd5275D47FFf082F9e8B4997dCCB253`
>GaugeType(string): Ethereum

>## Disclosure
>
>TokenLogic does not receive any payment for this proposal.

># Copyright
>
>Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal to enable initial gauges on Arbitrum and Base networks for Balancer V3 is recommended for approval. It aims to support early growth by launching select liquidity pools, primarily involving Aave and partnerships with Lido, Sky, and Seamless. The voting timeline shows unanimous and stable support for 'Yes', forum sentiment is positive to neutral, and similar past proposals with analogous goals also passed with strong support despite subsequent market declines.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous early and stable voting support for enabling initial gauges on new networks.
Forum discussion is positive or neutral, indicating community readiness for growth and new liquidity opportunities.
Similar past proposals successfully expanded protocol capabilities and received strong yes votes.
Supports Balancer's strategic expansion into Arbitrum and Base, increasing protocol utility and partnerships.
key_arguments_against: Historical similar proposals saw declines in token price and TVL post-vote, suggesting caution on market impacts.
Limited number of votes (4) may indicate a need for broader engagement before major changes.
Potential technical risks pending deployment of composite liquidity router, MEV tax hook, and Stable Surge.

evidence.quote: First comment positive about enabling gauges; second comment neutral excitement.
Lead ratio 1.0 for 'Yes', early ratio 1.0, stability 1.0 indicating strong early and sustained support.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline analysis, forum sentiment, and similar past proposals; not on final vote tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The voting timeline metrics demonstrate unanimous and stable support for the 'Yes' option, indicating early and sustained voter consensus.
• Forum sentiment is positive to neutral with community members expressing excitement and support for the initial gauge launches on Arbitrum and Base.
• Similar past proposals aimed at expanding protocol capabilities also passed with strong yes votes, though they experienced post-vote declines in token price and TVL, suggesting the need for cautious monitoring.
• Market impacts observed (positive price change but slight TVL decrease) do not contradict the strategic importance of the proposed changes.
• The recommendation aligns with aggregated forum sentiment and voting trends, reflecting community views while emphasizing long-term protocol growth and functionality.
